channel.title: Internet not working/slow
channel.description:
So I just moved back from college and I went to use my desktop but the internet is either not working (even though connected to the network) or insanely slow. However, my macbook pro is working as normal and everything is loading very quickly.
I've spent a few hours today googling solutions but nothing has worked. Anyone have any ideas on how I can try to fix this before I go ahead and restore it to factory settings?
Desktop uses windows 8

item.title: Internet not working/slow
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

TabbyKiller:

Or better yet, get an ethernet cord and experience 90% of what you pay your ISP. The other 10% is what you’re meant to be getting, instead they tell you bullshit excuses.

I get faster than advertised speed using wifi (which is still slow)

Read full topic

item.title: Internet not working/slow
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

I do agree it could be the adapter very likely. I have owned a couple of different Netgear adapters and they seem to have a variety of quality connections vs. crappy connections on the occasional day.

There are several factors here you should consider though also

-Many routers have a “power saver” mode. Make sure you are using the full power
-If the router has this “power saver” mode then make sure you also have the router/cable modem ( some are combined that’s why I say this ) make sure they are standing up properly. I have had to replace more than one motorola dual consoles from not realizing they overheat after 100% use so often.
-Does the internet seem to go out every 2 hours? 5 hours? 10 hours? what? ( It’s true some ISP companies will reset the connection which I assume is refreshing to a new ip ( hence dynamic ) but it still disconnects you. I found that one of my Netgear adapters would disconnect constantly cause it was going bad.
-Have you ever noticed your usb adapter gets extremely hot? I know a couple of adapters that have done this as well ( both name brand and off brand )

Read full topic

item.title: Internet not working/slow
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

TabbyKiller:

Or better yet, get an ethernet cord and experience 90% of what you pay your ISP. The other 10% is what you’re meant to be getting, instead they tell you bullshit excuses.

I would if I could but my desktop is too far from the router

item.title: Internet not working/slow
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

So it’s working right now. Literally didn’t change anything. My door is open to my room, maybe the signal is legit that bad it needs to be open, but I really doubt that. Oh well, I’m happy now Thanks for everyone who suggested stuff. I’m going to order a new wireless adapter to improve more hopefully.

Read full topic

item.title: Internet not working/slow
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

So…
http://www.amazon.com/Zonet-ZEW2546-802-11N-Wireless-Adapter/product-reviews/B002RTHKQO
Amazon’s “most helpful critical review”:

~Breaks Easily, ~WeaK wifi strength ~Bought 2 and i broke it too fast lol ~its worth it, but can get lost if not take carefully if using on laptops and such. ~ u can just leave it on desktops, or maybe recommended for desktops.
(Read another review. I don't believe this...)
I just needed this for a short time when I moved and did not want to spend a lot of dough. It is not dual channel but I got a consistent[b] 150 Mbps [/b]out if it. Works fine, great price.
Unless they were talking [url=http://i.imgur.com/q53aaQM.png]this speed[/url], that's total bs.

Also, seems you need to make sure you’ve got the drivers for Realtek RTL8191SU since that’s what is in the usb.

Read full topic

item.title: Internet not working/slow
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

If you don’t have spyware etc, then I am willing to blame your usb wireless adapter. It is unlikely to be the router if your mac is working fine.

Can you try the adapter on another computer? And just as a note, I had to replace my pci wireless adapter twice in just a few years.

Read full topic

item.title: Internet not working/slow
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:13, topic:542743”][quote author=marcbob link=topic=661618.msg4422454#msg4422454 date=1399137970]

Protip: Wired > Wireless.

But onto the topic at hand, it could be a driver problem as already mentioned. You may also want to check out your router to make sure the ip doesn’t have a cap on it, I’ve had a problem before were my router decided to cap traffic on my computer for no apparent reason. If this router is old and out dated, why not also upgrade and get a nice new shiny AC router which will be out dated this coming fall!

It’s a brand new router but I can still connect to it, just not get any internet.
[/quote]what type of router is it? and what type of Internet card / drivers do you have?[/quote]

Arris MG5225G is the router

I’m using zonet 802.11 usb wireless lan card

What I just tried was uninstalling the lan card and then reinstalling it. I had internet for about 1 minute (although insanely slow, took that whole time just to load moparscape). And now no page will load although I am still connected to the wifi.

Read full topic

item.title: Internet not working/slow
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:7, topic:542743”][quote author=marcbob link=topic=661618.msg4422308#msg4422308 date=1399059423]

Could be a driver problem or software problem causing this. I’d double check your hardware too.

Well I didn’t make any changes so I don’t think it would be that.

I just renewed my kaspersky license so maybe it could be something with its firewall blocking the internet. I don’t think so because i’ve always had it so i’m not sure. I’ve looked through its settings and can’t find anything different.

Also my parents got a new router/modem while I was gone, but again my laptop is working fine with it so i don’t think the security on there is the issue.
[/quote]
Have you tried disabling the security? If it’s causing the problem then I’m sure that there’s a setting to fix your issue?[/quote]
Tried disabling it, didn’t work

[quote=“Vain_, post:9, topic:542743”]can we stop bitchin bout 'tards and grammer and help dis boy out with his internets

@op have you checked all drivers / updated/reinstalled them?[/quote]
Gonna try that now

Read full topic

I’ve diagnosed your problem and have come to a conclusion.

It appears you’ve decided to install an operating system known as “Windows 8”. This OS is considered an epidemic and is fudgeing horrible across the board.
[/quote]
As an ex nurse in the Army, I have diagnosed your problem as mentally retarded. Unfortunantly there is no cure however you can do us all a favor by not posting stupid things :)[/quote]
I like the irony in calling me retarded in one sentence, then in the very next sentence spelling unfortunately wrong. And since I just have SO MUCH respect for “the Army”, I’ll take your diagnosis seriously regarding to my “problem as mentally retarded.”
